info.title: Eyevinn Demand Side Platform server
info.description: A simple Open Source Demand Side Platform for educational and testing purposes

post.summary: Provide a response to an Open RTB Bid Request

parameters.name: mock
parameters.description: When true provide a mockup BidResponse

id.description: Unique ID of the bid request, provided by the exchange

test.description: Indicator of test mode in which auctions are not billable, where 0 = live mode, 1 = test mode.

at.description: Auction type, where 1 = First Price, 2 = Second Price Plus.

tmax.description: Maximum time in milliseconds the exchange allows for bids to be received including Internet latency to avoid timeout. This value supersedes any a priori guidance from the exchange.

wseat.description: Whitelist of buyer seats allowed to bid on this impression. Seat IDs must be communicated between bidders and the exchange a priori. Omission implies no seat restrictions.

allimps.description: Flag to indicate if Exchange can verify that the impressions offered represent all of the impressions available in context (e.g., all on the web page, all video spots such as pre/mid/post roll) to support road-blocking. 0 = no or unknown, 1 = yes, the impressions offered represent all that are available.

cur.description: Array of allowed currencies for bids on this bid request using ISO-4217 alpha codes. Recommended only if the exchange accepts multiple currencies.

bcat.description: Blocked advertiser categories using the IAB content categories. Refer to List 5.1.

badv.description: Block list of advertisers by their domains (e.g., “ford.com”).

imp.description: Array of Imp objects (Section 3.2.4) representing the impressions offered.

id.description: A unique identifier for this impression within the context of the bid request (typically, starts with 1 and increments).

displaymanager.description: Name of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile). Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner. Recommended for video and/or apps.

displaymanagerver.description: Version of ad mediation partner, SDK technology, or player responsible for rendering ad (typically video or mobile). Used by some ad servers to customize ad code by partner. Recommended for video and/or apps.

instl.description: 1 = the ad is interstitial or full screen, 0 = not interstitial

tagid.description: Identifier for specific ad placement or ad tag that was used to initiate the auction. This can be useful for debugging of any issues, or for optimization by the buyer.

bidfloor.description: Minimum bid for this impression expressed in CPM

bidfloorcur.description: Currency specified using ISO-4217 alpha codes. This may be different from bid currency returned by bidder if this is allowed by the exchange.

secure.description: Flag to indicate if the impression requires secure HTTPS URL creative assets and markup, where 0 = non-secure, 1 = secure. If omitted, the secure state is unknown, but non-secure HTTP support can be assumed.

iframebuster.description: Array of exchange-specific names of supported iframe busters.

ext.description: Placeholder for exchange-specific extensions to OpenRTB.

app.description: Details via an App object (Section 3.2.7) about the publisher’s app (i.e., non-browser applications).

name.description: App name (may be aliased at the publisher’s request).

bundle.description: Application bundle or package name (e.g., com.foo.mygame); intended to be a unique ID across exchanges.

storeurl.description: App store URL for an installed app; for QAG 1.5 compliance.

keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords about the site.

device.description: Details via a Device object (Section 3.2.18) about the user’s device to which the impression will be delivered.

user.description: Details via a User object (Section 3.2.20) about the human user of the device; the advertising audience.

site.description: Details via a Site object (Section 3.2.13) about the publisher’s website.

name.description: Site name (may be aliased at the publisher’s request).

page.description: URL of the page where the impression will be shown.

ref.description: Referrer URL that caused navigation to the current page.

search.description: Search string that caused navigation to the current page.

privacypolicy.description: Indicates if the site has a privacy policy, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

keywords.description: Comma separated list of keywords about the site.

regs.description: A Regs object (Section 3.2.3) that specifies any industry, legal, or governmental regulations in force for this request.

video.description: A Video object (Section 3.2.7); required if this impression is offered as a video ad opportunity.

mimes.description: Content MIME types supported. Popular MIME types may include “video/x-ms-wmv” for Windows Media and “video/x-flv” for Flash Video.

minduration.description: Minimum video ad duration in seconds.

maxduration.description: Maximum video ad duration in seconds.

protocols.description: Array of supported video bid response protocols. Refer to List 5.8.

w.description: Width of the video player in pixels.

h.description: Height of the video player in pixels.

startdelay.description: Indicates the start delay in seconds for pre-roll, mid-roll, or post-roll ad placements. Refer to List 5.10 for additional generic values.

linearity.description: Indicates if the impression must be linear, nonlinear, etc. If none specified, assume all are allowed. Refer to List 5.7.

sequence.description: If multiple ad impressions are offered in the same bid request, the sequence number will allow for the coordinated delivery of multiple creatives.

battr.description: Blocked creative attributes. Refer to List 5.3.

maxextended.description: Maximum extended video ad duration if extension is allowed. If blank or 0, extension is not allowed. If -1, extension is allowed, and there is no time limit imposed. If greater than 0, then the value represents the number of seconds of extended play supported beyond the maxduration value.

minbitrate.description: Minimum bit rate in Kbps. Exchange may set this dynamically or universally across their set of publishers.

maxbitrate.description: Maximum bit rate in Kbps. Exchange may set this dynamically or universally across their set of publishers.

boxingallowed.description: Indicates if letter-boxing of 4:3 content into a 16:9 window is allowed, where 0 = no, 1 = yes.

playbackmethod.description: Allowed playback methods. If none specified, assume all are allowed. Refer to List 5.9.

delivery.description: Supported delivery methods (e.g., streaming, progressive). If none specified, assume all are supported. Refer to List 5.13.

pos.description: Ad position on screen. Refer to List 5.4.

api.description: List of supported API frameworks for this impression. Refer to List 5.6. If an API is not explicitly listed, it is assumed not to be supported.

pmp.description: A Pmp object (Section 3.2.17) containing any private

publisher.description: Details about the Publisher (Section 3.2.8) of the site.

content.description: Details about the Content (Section 3.2.9) within the site.

cat.description: Array of IAB content categories of the site. Refer to List 5.1.

sectioncat.description: Array of IAB content categories that describe the current section of the site. Refer to List 5.1.

pagecat.description: Array of IAB content categories that describe the current page or view of the site. Refer to List 5.1.
